p: The antibacterial activity of synthesized AgNPs was determined by the well diffusion method against Bacillus subtilis ( B. subtilis), Staphylococcus aureus ( S. aureus), Escherichia coli ( E. coli), and Klebsiella pneumoniae ( K. pneumoniae) on Muller-Hinton agar plates. The incubated bacterial culture (10 7/mL) was swabbed uniformly using a sterile cotton swab. Various concentrations of (5–20 µg/mL) silver nanoparticles were poured into each well on all the plates after which they were incubated at 37 °C for 18 h. After incubation, the clear zone appeared, and it was measured as a zone of inhibition. Standard antibiotic tetracycline was used as a positive control [ 43].
